articles.author: Catarina Demony, Andrew Hofstetter
articles.description: Emigration specialists say that a significant number of Americans have shown an interest in moving abroad in recent years, and that there has been a spike since Donald Trump returned to the White House.
articles.title: Fearful of Trump, some Americans look to make a life in Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy, speaking at a news conference in Prague alongside Czech President Petr Pavel, said that unless increased pressure were applied, Vladimir Putin would take no real steps to end the conflict.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy, in Prague, says ceasefire could be put in place at any moment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military has already begun issuing tens of thousands of call-up orders for its reserve forces.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet approves expansion of Gaza offensive, broadcaster Kan reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The federal prison at Alcatraz housed notorious U.S. criminals such as Al Capone before it closed in 1963.
articles.title: Trump orders the reopening of Alcatraz prison

articles.author: Saeed Shah, Shivam Patel
articles.description: India and Pakistan have significantly upgraded their military capabilities since the nuclear-armed neighbours clashed in 2019, posing increased risks of escalation even in a limited conflict, former military officers and experts say.
articles.title: With militaries upgraded, risks multiply in any potential India-Pakistan conflict

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Elizaveta Gladun
articles.description: Political analysts said a victory for hard-right eurosceptic George Simion could isolate the country, erode private investment and destabilize NATO's eastern flank, where Ukraine is fighting Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Romanian nationalist Simion on course for election win, exit polls show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A missile launched from Yemen towards Israel on Sunday landed near Ben Gurion Airport, the country's main international airport, where footage shared on social media showed a plume of smoke visible from a passenger terminal.
articles.title: Missile launched from Yemen lands near Israel's main airport

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas officials accused some of the looters of working in collaboration with Israel, which has sealed off aid from entering Gaza for the past two months. Israel has not commented on the allegation.
articles.title: Hamas executes looters in Gaza as food crisis worsens under Israeli blockade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Defence Minister Aziz Nasirzadeh said on Sunday that Tehran would strike back if the United States or Israel attacked.
articles.title: Iran says it will strike back if US or Israel attack

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Migrant children crossing Mexico in hopes of reaching the United States face alarming levels of violence, exclusion and prolonged uncertainty before, during and after their journey, according to a study published on Monday by Save the Children and Plan International.
articles.title: Migrant children face fear and lack safety crossing Mexico, study shows
